definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Not very much. You are a turnkey at the Conciergerie?
sentences.chinese: 要你干的并不太多。你在附属监狱管牢房么？

sentences.english: Some of you have come fresh from narrow jail cells.
sentences.chinese: 你们有些人刚刚走出狭小的牢房。

sentences.english: A group of armed guards have arrived and are waiting outside the gate.
sentences.chinese: 一队武装警卫抵达并守卫在牢房区大门处。

sentences.english: He was happy, however, that he was not in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他还是挺开心的，因为他不用呆在牢房里。

sentences.english: These are walls much, much larger than the ones that surround my cell.
sentences.chinese: 这是比围在我牢房四周的墙壁还要厚得多多的墙壁。

sentences.english: We knocked on the walls and spoke to our neighbors through the electrical sockets.
sentences.chinese: 我们在墙上敲打，透过插座和隔壁牢房的人说话。

sentences.english: They are in Gongmen jail, at Black Dragon area.
sentences.chinese: 他们被关在宫门城牢房，在黑龙区。

sentences.english: A student was jailed for claiming that cancer had killed eight village officials in Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 一名学生因宣称癌症导致云南九名村官去世而蹲牢房。

sentences.english: I just wanna go back to my cel, cause in my cell, I can smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我只想回到我的牢房内，因为这样我才可以抽烟。

sentences.english: I think this is probably why Damone smokes in his cell alone.
sentences.chinese: 我想这就是迪默可能想独自在牢房抽烟的原因了。

sentences.english: The next day the interrogators asked me about all the things we three had been speaking about in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 隔日审问者问我们三个人昨天在牢房说了些什么。

sentences.english: A C.O. bangs on the cell door.
sentences.chinese: 一个狱警敲击了一下他们牢房的门。

sentences.english: Digital captives are, after all, cheaper to sustain than the real ones.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟数码俘虏总比真的把他们关键牢房更节省成本。

sentences.english: This convicted killer has been on death row for 5 years.
sentences.chinese: 这位被判决死刑的杀人犯住在死囚牢房已5年了。

sentences.english: A second tunnel branched off to the criminal side of the prison, according to the warden, Gen. Ghulam Dastagir Mayar, and Mr. Wesa.
sentences.chinese: 地道的另一个分支通到了另一边服刑犯的牢房。

sentences.english: Kim aborts her escape and returns to her "cell".
sentences.chinese: 金姆放弃了她的逃跑计划，返回到她的“牢房”中。

definition: a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
prison cell containing water, in which prisoners are forced to be partly immersed
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
